ThingDef.label: Jagras
ThingDef.description: A dog-sized iguana thing. Sticks in packs and worships dreadlocks.

ThingDef.label: Girros
ThingDef.description: Monsters that are known to attack in packs, using the deadly vapor of the Rotten Vale to their advantage. They're known to crippling targets with their paralyzing fangs.

ThingDef.label: Aptonoth
ThingDef.description: A docile herbivore dinosaur. It's meat is quite a delicacy, enjoyed by both humans and carnivore animals alike.

ThingDef.label: Rhenoplos
ThingDef.description: Rhenoplos is a quadrupedal, Ceratopsian-like monster with an armored body. Its face features a small nose horn and is surrounded by a frill.

ThingDef.label: Slagtoth
ThingDef.description: Slagtoth have green, saggy hides covering most of their body, most notably drooping near the sides of the head and along their flanks. They have pale yellow underbellies and black crests and noses.

ThingDef.label: Kelbi
ThingDef.description: A medium-sized herding herbivore which prefers to live in mixed forests and plains. Deer are very quick.

ThingDef.label: Jaggi
ThingDef.description: Highly social, carnivorous bird wyverns that live in large packs. Young Jaggi males hunt in groups when attacking larger animals, and have been known to steal wyvern eggs. Research suggest they operate under orders from a single alpha male.

ThingDef.label: Kestodon
ThingDef.description: Kestodon has an appearance similar to a Pachycephalosaurus. The male Kestodon are bright orange in color and have a large head crest, which is used for headbutting rivals. Female Kestodon are bronze in color though lack the head crest found in males.

ThingDef.label: Gastodon
ThingDef.description: Gastodon resembles a cross between a theropod and a bison. It is covered in scales but has a large furry mane and horns reminiscent of a bison.

ThingDef.label: apceros
ThingDef.description: Apceros are herbivorous reptiles that frequent desert and volcanic areas. They have a body structure similar to Aptonoth, their evolutionary cousins. They have many characteristics of tortoises, such as head shape and a protective shell. Their tails have a developed mace-like structure on the end that is covered with sharp spikes.

ThingDef.label: Shamos
ThingDef.description: Shamos has unusually large eyes that allow it to see in pure darkness. Shamos are aggressive hunters that will attack in small packs. They will often group together in order to scare off potential predators such as Tzitzi-Ya-Ku.

ThingDef.label: Delex
ThingDef.description: Carnivorous monsters that inhabit deserts. Delex travel in schools of around five. When near large monsters on a hunt, they attempt to surround the prey and scavenge food. Known to flee if other Delex are injured. They can move much faster on sand than on hard ground.

ThingDef.label: Bullfango
ThingDef.description: Bullfangos are a fairly large quadrupedal boar-like species of Fanged Beast. \n Mainly covered in brown fur, they have whitish underbellies along with darker grayish tufts on their heads and backs. \n Jutting out from their backs are two rows of boney spikes. Their heads feature a pair of small pointy ears, cyan eyes with round pupils, a long pointed snout, and a pair of large tusks that stretch out forward and curve upwards at the tip.
